title: Nifty: Weak Data May Extend Exhaustion Even More
text:
On analysis of the economic data, announced on Monday after the closing of trading session of Indian equity markets, I find that growing Fiscal Deficit (August), Balance of Payments, Current Account % of GDP (QoQ) (Q2), Trade Balance, Foreign Debt (Q2) and Infrastructure Output (YoY) (August) look evident enough to turn the focus of Indian equity markets over the prevailing weakness in Indian economy; which may create one more gap-down on October 1st, 2019.

On one hand, Indian equity markets have been constantly facing bearish pressures from the growth slowdown at global level, domestic weakness makes the situation more precarious than ever before. No doubt that the Indian equity markets bounce with steep upward moves on September 20th, 2019 (Friday) and September 23rd, 2019 (Monday) with boosting measures announced by the Indian Finance Minister Mrs. Nirmala Sitharaman on September 19th, followed by news-inflow on Modi-Trump Trade deal on September 21st, 3029; but since the persisting weakness in Indian economic scenario looks evident enough to evaporate the gains of and during this week.

Economic Calendar

On analysis of the , in different time frames, I find that the steepness of downward moves on September 30th, 2019 looks evident enough to reflect the prevailing weakness in Indian equity markets. No doubt that the Nifty 50 witnessed good recovery before the closing of the trading session, but could not recover a little bit and closed in negative territory; which may constantly remain weak after the announcement of weak data on Monday. Finally, I conclude that the global economy is slowing, and will continue to weigh down by unresolved tariff trade and recent tightening. Secondly, the growing dilemma over a deal or no deal between the U.S. and China will keep the global equity markets under more bearish pressure.
